io.codecastle.scriptorium.json.scribe

Interface JsonScribe

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Appendable, AutoCloseable, Closeable, FluentAppendable<JsonScribe>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FastJsonScribe, SafeJsonScribe

    public interface JsonScribe
extends FluentAppendable<JsonScribe>, Closeable
    A stack-based API to producing valid JSON output.

    Methods beginning with the word push add a state to the top of a hypothetical stack, making that state the current state. The pop() and pop(int) methods pop states off the stack, potentially outputting properly nested closing tokens. Other methods may have state-specific behaviors (or may be illegal in certain states), but do not modify the current state.

    When the state semantic is misused by callers, implementers may throw unchecked exceptions instead of producing invalid or unexpected output.

    • Method Detail

      • emptyArray

        JsonScribe emptyArray()
               throws IOException
        Outputs an empty JSON array, preceded by a comma if necessary, and returns this object.

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called when in the array state, or when in the object state immediately following a key. Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        pushArray()

      • pushArray

        JsonScribe pushArray()
              throws IOException
        Outputs the opening bracket of a JSON array, preceded by a comma if necessary, and returns this object.

        After a call to this method, a call to pop() will output the closing bracket of the array and return the scribe to its previous state.

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called when in the array state, or when in the object state immediately following a key. A JSON array fragment may be formed by calling this method on a new scribe. Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • pushValue

        JsonScribe pushValue()
              throws IOException
        Outputs the opening quotation mark of a JSON string literal, preceded by a comma if necessary, and returns this object.

        After a call to this method, a call to pop() will output the closing quotation mark of the string and return the scribe to its previous state.

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called when in the array state, or when in the object state immediately following a key. Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • value

        JsonScribe value(CharSequence value)
          throws IOException
        Outputs a string literal containing the contents of the provided value, preceded by a comma if necessary, and returns this object.

        The contents of the provided value will be quoted and escaped.

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called when in the array state, or when in the object state immediately following a key. Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

        Parameters:
        value - the value to append. The contents will be quoted and escaped.
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

        JsonScribe value(float value)
          throws IOException
        Outputs a numeric literal, preceded by a comma if necessary, and returns this object.

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called when in the array state, or when in the object state immediately following a key. Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

      • value

        default JsonScribe value(Object value)
                  throws IOException
        Outputs a value literal, preceded by a comma if necessary, and returns this object.

        Implementations should dispatch to type-specific overloads based on the runtime type of the provided argument. Byte, Short, Integer, Float, Long, Double, Character, and Boolean arguments should be auto-unboxed.

        Null arguments of any type should output null literals.

        Implementations may throw an IllegalArgumentException if a non-null argument of an unsupported type is provided.

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called when in the array state, or when in the object state immediately following a key. Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        IllegalArgumentException - if the runtime type of a non-null argument is not supported

      • pushObject

        JsonScribe pushObject()
               throws IOException
        Outputs the opening brace of a JSON object, preceded by a comma if necessary, and returns this object.

        After a call to this method, a call to pop() will output the closing brace of the object and return the scribe to its previous state.

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called when in the array state, or when in the object state immediately following a key. A JSON object document may be formed by calling this method on a new scribe. Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • pushKey

        JsonScribe pushKey()
            throws IOException
        Outputs the opening quotation mark of a JSON key, preceded by a comma if necessary, and returns this object.

        After a call to this method, a call to pop() will output the closing quotation mark of the key followed by a colon, and return the scribe to its previous state.

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called when in the object state. Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • key

        JsonScribe key(CharSequence key)
        throws IOException
        Outputs a JSON key containing the contents of the provided key, preceded by a comma if necessary, and returns this object.

        The contents of the provided key will be quoted and escaped, and followed by a colon.

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called when in the object state. Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

        Parameters:
        key - the key to append. The contents will be quoted and escaped, and followed by a colon.
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • pop

        JsonScribe pop()
        throws IOException
        Returns to the previous scribe state and returns this object.

        When the scribe is in the array state, a call to this method outputs a closing bracket.

        When the scribe is in the object state, a call to this method outputs a closing brace.

        When the scribe is in the value state, a call to this method outputs a quotation mark.

        When the scribe is in the key state, a call to this method outputs a quotation mark followed by a colon.

        If this method is called without being preceded by a corresponding call to a push*() method, implementations may throw an IllegalStateException

        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • getCursor

        int getCursor()
        Returns a cursor representing the current state of the scribe.
        Returns:
        a cursor
        See Also:
        pop(int)

      • pop

        JsonScribe pop(int cursor)
        throws IOException
        Returns the scribe to the state represented by the cursor and returns this object.

        Characters will be output as though pop() were called in succession until the desired state was reached.

        Implementations may throw IllegalStateException if the provided cursor represents an invalid state, or a state that has already been popped.

        Parameters:
        cursor - a cursor previously returned by getCursor()
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        getCursor(), pop(), close()

      • close

        void close()
    throws IOException
        Returns the scribe to its initial state.

        Characters will be output as though pop() were called in succession until the initial state was reached.

        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • append

        JsonScribe append(CharSequence sequence)
           throws IOException
        Outputs the provided sequence as a JSON string and returns this object.

        The contents of the sequence will be escaped.

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called after a call to pushValue() or pushKey(). Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

        Specified by:
        append in interface Appendable
        Specified by:
        append in interface FluentAppendable<JsonScribe>
        Parameters:
        sequence - the sequence to append. The contents of the sequence will be escaped.
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        append(CharSequence, int, int), append(char), Appendable.append(CharSequence)

      • append

        JsonScribe append(CharSequence sequence,
                  int start,
                  int end)
           throws IOException
        Outputs the provided sequence as a JSON string and returns this object.

        The contents of the sequence will be escaped.

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called after a call to pushValue() or pushKey(). Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

        Specified by:
        append in interface Appendable
        Specified by:
        append in interface FluentAppendable<JsonScribe>
        Parameters:
        sequence - the sequence to append. The contents of the sequence will be escaped.
        start - the index of the first character of the sequence to append
        end - the first index after the last character of the sequence to append
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        append(CharSequence), append(char), Appendable.append(CharSequence, int, int)

      • append

        JsonScribe append(char character)
           throws IOException
        Outputs the provided character as a JSON string and returns this object.

        The character will be escaped.

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called after a call to pushValue() or pushKey(). Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

        Specified by:
        append in interface Appendable
        Specified by:
        append in interface FluentAppendable<JsonScribe>
        Parameters:
        character - the character to append. The character will be escaped.
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        append(CharSequence), append(CharSequence, int, int), Appendable.append(char)

      • pushInscription

        JsonScribe pushInscription(FluentNode<?> inscription)
        Registers an inscription node that will be closed the next time this scribe's pop(), pop(int), or close() methods are called.

        Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called twice with different arguments between calls to the above-named methods.

        Parameters:
        inscription - the inscription node to register to be closed
